subject: Self Care
title: The Phone-Free Morning
description: A fast breakdown of The Phone-Free Morning for builders.

hook.text: The first thing 80% of people do each morning is check their phone. Someone else's agenda starts your day for you.

buildup.text: Morning phone use puts your brain in reactive mode. Emails, news, and messages set the tone before you do.

discovery.text: A phone-free first hour lets you set intentions, plan your day, and start proactively instead of reactively.

twist.text: The fear of missing something urgent is almost always unfounded. Very few morning messages are true emergencies.

climax.text: Buy an alarm clock. Charge your phone outside the bedroom. Own your first hour. The difference is immediate.

punchline.text: Own your morning hour. The phone can wait 60 minutes.

quiz.question: Why is a phone-free first hour beneficial?
options: Phones don't work in the morning
It lets you set intentions proactively instead of reacting to others
